intro: Habenaria katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests or along riverbanks. Its flowering stems usually bear several showy, lance-shaped blooms. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
